reviewText:
There is not much to say about these other than WOW are they comfortable. The material is light and breathable while the fit contours to your body. The side straps rest gently on the hips and do not dig in with the thong strap itself is hardly noticeable. The first pair purchased was a size to small, but that was because I failed to look at the size chart, the second pair were perfect. They are great for daily wear while at work, or for more strenuous activities such as running, biking or even yoga. The design which allows air to get between the fabric and the body keeps you cool and dry making these both a fashion statement as well as a great addition to your collection whatever the purpose.

The price is what seals the deal in that in todays underwear market for men. When the average thong or jock can run you close to $10, finding a comfortable thong for 60 - 70% less is a steal! Then when that garment turns out to be made with quality to last wear after wear and wash after wash you cannot beat it. I have purchased each color twice because of how comfortable these are and how versatile they have become. They work well for everyday for the office, while working just as well running on the track. Not to mention their flexibility in the yoga studio or fashionable to wear with a nice suit or tux on the town (mainly for the fun after the event). Highly suggest these if thongs are your style or if you are looking to give them a try. Most people sneer or laugh at the thought of wearing a thong, but in most cases they have never tried it. While many that have tried rarely go back to the baggy and completely unflattering world of boxers and brief.
summary: Low Price, High Quality, Amazingly Comfortable Fit and Colors Colors Everywhere!

reviewText:
The front of the garment is snug and holds everything in place quite nicely.  This is my first thong, so I wasn't quite sure what to expect, but the price was right, so I got it.  The seams around the leg holes are thick and abrasive.  This can cause irritation to the sensitive skin if the back of the thong doesn't settle in right.  The mesh isn't as fine as I'd like, but is better than I expected.

I say it is "somewhat small" but I am a bit on the larger size of the range for what they said for medium, so that was to be expected.  The washing instructions are simple; hand-washing being ideal since I live in an apartment and the laundry facilities are for everyone here.  I'd rather not share these particular underwear tastes with everyone on the block.  Being able to clean these in the privacy of my own home is great.

The color is great, with just a hint of feminine.  Black, navy, and white can be so boring.  I wouldn't mind if they came in a pink though.
summary: Color just about perfect.  Fabric rough and abrasive, but snug and nice fit.

reviewText:
I bought this dress as my first lolita dress because it was reasonably priced, came in a size xxl, and was protected by the amazon marketplace guidelines if it came out hideous.

I am happy to say this is a quality dress. It was obviously made to order, judging from the residual chalk lines for button hole and strap placement. The construction is just immaculate though. The fabric is a nice solid cotton broadcloath and feels fantastic and the shirred backing is very forgiving.

So you might be asking yourself why isn't this a 4 or 5 star review? Well there seem to be some issues with the grading of the sizes, If you were not an xxl this might fit better, or maybe if you go for the custom sizing. But for the xxl that I received the straps are like two inches too short. We are talking the sides are all up in my armpits and the waist of the dress is an inch or two above my waist on my body! Not so flattering with full skirted designs. Also while there are darts at the waist  there's no tapering above the waist... so if you're busty like me there's going to be a lot of extra fabric flapping around the top edge of the bodice.

I'm sure after I get it back from the tailor who is doing alterations is going to be an adorable dress. If they fixed their large sizes I would definitely buy another of their dresses.

So if you have a stick figure or want to try the custom sizing, this is an excellent deal.
If you are curvy, expect to pay for $30 worth of alterations, but even then it is a pretty good deal for the cost.

reviewText: This was a great buy!  If you're patriotic...this is a must buy!

We LOVE this brand!  I love the fact that I can buy economical, organic pajamas for my son!  These fit fantastic!  We have smaller sizes for him as well and compared to pajamas from Carter's and Gymboree, these hardly shrink at all.  They still fit him well as he is growing out of each size (compared to the other brands where his tummy will be sticking out!).  They are such cute designs and have such an array of choices.  Even when my son doesn't want to go to bed, he usually is asking for his pajamas by name (design) which at least eases that part of the bedtime routine!
I am usually "green" in many of my choices when it comes to personal care, hygiene, cleaning and food items, but it can really break the bank buying clothing that is organic.  While these are more expensive than the commercial, popular brands, I don't think it's such an exorbitant amount that puts them out of the budget (especially compared to other organic clothing items).
(I bought a few designs, so I'm posting the same review for them since the designs are the only thing that is different.)

Did I receive the wrong item?
Where are my fleece lined cotton leggings?
These are not seamless leggings, they are seamed footless tights.

Nothing at all like the description:
  Cotton
  Seamless material eliminates annoying bulges from fabric
  Lined with heavy weight fleece for extra warmth
  Polyspandex shell stretches for comfortable fit
  Great for all day wear & cold weather
  Plus size fits most sizes 12 and up

1. They are not cotton, they are 92% Nylon and 8% Spandex.
2. They are not seamless.
3. They are not lined with heavy weight fleece for extra warmth.
4. There is no Polyspandex shell.
5. They are not a Plus size, they are regular sizes XL. They fit above the ankle on my 5' tall daughter.

If you need fleece plus leggings try: D&K Monarchy Full Leggings (Thick)(Plus)

What you have here is an ok watch strap.

The metal that the strap is made out of is quite stiff. The band holders (not sure their name, there are 2 of them) feel very sharp and a bit poorly made. Because the watch is so stiff, it makes it hard to actually strap the watch around your wrist completely at times. It will only curve so far, as you see in the photo, that's about as far as it will bend. which makes the strap feel like a straight blade when putting it on.

If you want the look, go for it, it'll do the joband that's what it's doing for my watch at the moment. But if you're looking for a watch strap that is comfortable and can be worn throughout the day, or has a bit of movement and flexibility around your wrist, look elsewhere. This thing pinches and snags are your arm hair.

The strap is easily adjustable, so don't worry about that.

reviewText: Excellent socks - superior design, durable, warmer than anything on the market.  just good all the way around.  I buy these for everyone in the family.  Fuzzy, warm, durable.  No wool so no scratches.  Will keep your feet warm down to very low temps.  Breathe VERY well but still hot.  We tried every electric/heated gadget on the market, and simply all have gotchas.  But these work all the time and work better than any electric - they've tried to make a good electric sock for 50 years and just can't do it.  These keep your feet warm from knee down to your toes, better than electrics, and no batteries, chargers or anything else to worry about.  Oh - I would highly suggest you get the "tall" version.  They're only $1.00 more and instead of 1/2 way up your calf, they go all the way to the knees.  Half of keeping your feet warm means keeping your legs warm also.  BTW - stamped "Heat Holders" on ONE sock only - on every pair I've got.  What's up with that?

I am giving this shirt 4 stars and hope I don't have to come back after washing it to give a negative update.  Fingers crossed!

First, it arrived on time and on the earliest day of it's expected delivery date range.  BONUS!  Love that.

The colors are beautiful and just like the photo.  The fit is as I expected, and my 13yo son loves it.

After reading other reviews, I will likely give it a vinegar/water soak before washing in case the colors aren't set.  At this price range, I would think it prudent to do what I can to keep the colors vibrant.  Also, it is 100% cotton and a bit rough-feeling (which to me equates to sort of a cheaper-grade cotton) so I am expecting it to shrink if I don't wash in cold.  It's okay, I've got room for it to shrink, but again, I am reserving the right to come back after washing to update my score.  But my son loved this shirt so much, he put it on immediately, so I'm likely not getting it back for a few days.  LOL.  I will report back!

REPORTING BACK:  The colors were fine.  I soaked the shirt in probably 2 quarts of cold water with a cup of vinegar in it before machine washing just in case and forgot about it for 2 days.  When I went back, the water was only slightly colored so very minimal fading.  It washed up great in warm water, no shrinkage, and is currently my son's favorite shirt.
summary: Beautiful and great price for my teen!

reviewText: After reviewing other ratings for this dress, I decided that it was going to be the exact dress I was looking for. Turns out, it did not disappoint. Like the other reviewers stated, depending on your body type or personal style, you may not like the way this dress fits. I love a loose flowy top or dress and usually wear a medium, but I ordered a large in this dress. If I had gone with a medium,  it would have fit, but would have been too short for my taste.  Overall,  this dress is great and I'll be ordering it again in more colors!

I ordered this dress for my daughter's wedding.  I was walking her down the isle.  She wanted me and the mother of the groom in a salmon or fleshtone colored dress to match the one pink flower in her bouquet.  I specifically emailed this company my bust measurements as well as my measurement under my busts when I ordered the dress.  When the dress arrived it was too small...I could not close it in the back.  After contacting their customer service and going through emails it turned out they had given my measurement of under the bust as the bust size.  They offered to make me another one and at my own expense for shipping, mail it to me..me keeping the one that was ruined.  I thought maybe that would work...I would need to redye the dress since when it arrived it is not the coral or salmon in the picture it is a peach, like a sherbert peach. I"m a seamstress so I knew the top of this according to the picture would fit well on me being busty.  From the picture it looked like the top would be very comfortable and not at all stiff. When it arrived the bodice was so lined with thick heavy duty lining that it was stiff with no give in it, the sleeves were lined with the same horrid lining.  I figured when the other dress arrived I could take the lining out myslef, hem it appropriately and then dye it with some RIT dye and make it a more salmon color.  Of course I also only had two weeks till the wedding.  I told the customer service person to not start on it that I wanted to think about it some more.  After sleeping, I opted to change my mind and not have them make me another one. I thought the fabric was a bit on the cheap side for such a gown as is in the picture.  The chiffon on it is definitely of the cheaper kind making the dress very heavy and 'off the rack' looking.  You almost hear a raspy rustle when you move in it...the sound of cheap fabrics.  I would be too stressed awaiting it and would spend more money because I would need to buy another dress in the event the new one arriving was not the correct size.  Their customer service was very nice until I told them I was changing my mind on having a new one sent to me.  They changed the return terms for me...I had to return the dress and would take a hit on the shipping, what it cost when I ordered it and I would also have to pay for my own shipping to get it back to them...in CHINA!  That would be approximately $65.00.  I've been a single mother for 20 years...their father did not help with this wedding or my other daughter's wedding...like I told the CSR person...I did not have returns to China per their mistake budgeted into my wedding money.  So I sit now on a loss of $140 including shipping and a dress that will never ever be worn.  All because they put the wrong measurements into the dress. I will never purchase something like this out of our country ever again.

reviewText: I love the way my wife looks in the girdle. She loves the way she looks and feels in this girdle. She looks beyond fantastic in her Rago 9357 Body Briefer with the same red/black design and this is the perfect addition to her girdle collection stable. Rago has done it again in the area of function meets SEXY. This is comfortable enough to wear all day under her business skirts and skirt suits and never has to worry about sagging stockings thanks to the firm fit and the 6 attached garters. The girdle also provides great lower and mid-back support for the long days at work or evenings of "play." Pair this with a long line bra and sheer stockings and heels and you have a recipe for "action and adventure! Thanks Rago and thanks Amazon for making this product available in this style and color. We will be back for more....can't wait to try the other colors. Please keep the red and black available though...its a winner!!!

reviewText:
This shirt looks awesome on my long lean 16 year old child. Yes it's see through, but that's what it looks like on the pictures so why are some of you acting all surprised???? In Europe I am an average woman, 5'4, 118 pounds, medium size .... living in the US, I find myself having to look in the teenagers section to find clothes that fit me ....
I am looking to buy the same shirt in other colors. And no ... I was not paid to write this review, and I did not get the shirt for free .... it's just a nice item that I would highly recommend because it looks really sharp, kind of the shirts you would find in high end Italian brands ....

reviewText: To be fair, I saw all the reviews that spoke of the gold plating coming off this necklace -- that's why I bought it. I hate yellow gold, but I love silver. I love the formatting of the text, the font, and the size of the necklace in general. It's one of my favorites. I took off one star just because it's difficult to keep the text flipped in the right direction when there's virtually no room to move it around on the chain.

After a long time on my wish list, I finally bought this necklace using an Amazon gift card I was giving for my birthday. The necklace arrived and was perfect!

However, the necklace arrived two weeks ago, and it has already lost its gold-playing (see the photo). I take the necklace off every evening and never shower with it. For something that was rather pricey for what it is, I expected it to hold up better. I'm pretty disappointed, because I don't like silver-colored jewelry, and now, that's what I have.

Would not recommend.

reviewText:
Great compression shirt. It feels really good and the seams are very smooth causing no discomfort at all. It does its job wicking away moisture and keeping you cooler. If you're looking for a good quality compression shirt without paying those name brand prices then just add to cart and proceed to checkout, but you better hurry because I am about to do the same.
  I received this product for a discount in exchange for my honest review.

This shirt is really sweet!!! I am a huge Under armour person. Dang near everything I have for the gym is under armour so I was a little nervous to give this brand a shot but I figured what the heck. I couldn't find anything Under Armour that looked like this shirt did and the look of this shirt is exactly what I was looking for. With that said I received this shirt in the mail and tried it on. It fit perfect! It was exactly what I was expecting when it came to fit and fell. Now the real test was gonna be how it performed at the gym. It passed with flying colors. It seems like some what I am gonna call of brands ( because it isn't under armour) that are compression fit tend to ride up on you when or working out. Shirt never moved. It was great. My next concern was how it would do with wicking sweat away. Once again this shirt passed. It breathes really nice and doesn't become soaking wet like other off brand sports shirts I have tried. The overall quality of this shirt is great. The fabric isn't scratchy or stiff at all. The shirt stays in place and is very good at wicking away sweat. I would have absolutely no problem recommending this shirt to anyone. It is a really nice product. I definitely will be purchasing more of them myself. As a disclaimer I did receive this product at a discount for my honest and unbiased review of this product.

I obviously did not read about this product. I had been looking for a compression tank top for my son and there were many to choose from. I decided on this one because I thought I was going to get 2 in the package. The picture shows two shirts. Two of the exact same shirt. The same picture. Not the front and the back. Not the front and the side. The same picture. Plus- the name of the product has a number 2 in it. Since we were going for quantity and not necessarily quality, we decided on this. I was so excited that we were going to get 2 shirts for about the same price as others were selling 1.
However that is my fault. I should have investigated it more. But oh well now we own it.
My son wanted a compression shirt because he feels that his "moobs" (man boobs) are too big. I can't see them. But he is uncomfortable wearing t-shirts by themselves. He will wear a hoodie even if it is a hot day. He can wear a large or even an extra large shirt. So we thought getting a large would work for him. He notices that if he sticks or Puffs out his chest, he notices the compression more and feels that it is doing its job. But if he is relaxed and just hanging out, he doesn't feel like it is small enough. He wore it the first day, and he liked it. But when the day was over, he really didn't know how he felt about it anymore. And he hasn't worn it since. I think if it was just a little bit smaller it would be perfect. We like that it is a tank top that way he can wear it under shirts. But he will probably have to wait either a few months or a year so he can grow a little bit more to fit into it. So now the search is on for another good deal.
* I received this product at a discount in exchange for a review.
summary: he doesn't feel like it is small enough

I've search and searched for the perfect makeup case, and so far, this is it. My bathroom doesn't afford me a drawer or shelf where I can keep my makeup. Instead, I have everything in a bag and have to work out of it every day. Every. Single. Day. So keeping things organized and accessible is a necessity. I've gotten so tired of riffling through a tall makeup bag searching for that eyeliner that's on the very bottom, and it seems that's how the vast majority of bags are constructed. But this one is different. It opens all the way around so I can see everything at once! It's also just rigid enough to hold its shape (so things don't fall out), but pliable enough to zip closed even when I've shoved another eyeshadow palette into it. In the zipper pocket on the lid, I keep about 5 eyeliners. The clear zipper bag that was inside holds all of my brushes. I threw away the little mirror as I have a much better one that I just use for travel anyway. And then in the main compartment I have: a bottle of liquid foundation, an undereye concealer, mascara, eyelash curler, eyebrow gel, powder, bronzer, highlighter, two sizable eyeshadow palettes and 5 liquid shadows. That all fits easily IF I leave the bag with the brushes separate. Or I can put that inside if I take out one (very large) eyeshadow palette. And even with all that in there, I can see and access all the products easily. Nothing gets buried at the bottom. Oh, I do keep all my lipsticks in a separate bag because I have a lot of them, but I would guess 2 or 3 would easily fit in the main compartment. The bag also seems very well constructed, and the fabric has a great finish on it that keeps it from getting wet or dirty.
summary: Perfect beautiful and functional makeup bag.

This dress looks adorable in the pictures and, when I received it, it looked just like the picture of the one hanging up. Then I tried it on.
Let me start off by saying Im 5'1" and 105 lbs. I am pretty small all around and it was hard getting this dress over my head. Once it was on it fit correctly, but it wouldn't fit anyone bigger than me. It is incredibly short so theres so way you could wear it out without leggings or pants. The model in the picture must be 95 lbs because thats the only way this dress will fit someone like it does in the picture.
Anyway, the skirt poofs at really strange angles too- in the front making you look way bigger than you are, rather than the back (like it does in the picture). It would take a ton of styling and messing with the top grey layer to make it look like it does in the picture of the back where it has 3 tiers.
It took a good amount of time to get here but thats because it came from China so Im not complaining about that.
Overall I would NOT recommend this dress. I only have it 3 stars because, if worn with the right leggings or pants and adjusted, it could look cute and it is what is in the picture. Its a one size fits all dress but that size is very tiny so unless you are very tiny, probably not a good buy.
summary: Not What it Appears to be

I ordered the blue one with the faded red/brown looking stripes in hopes that the shirt would be that "worn" feel and look rustic -- it's exactly that. It looks like it has been worn and put through the washer for years. The collar isn't stiff like a typical dress shirt is, it's very relaxed. The colors are faded and the shirt has that old rustic look which blends well with the "old fashioned" appearance. As a Large wearing person, I went for the XXL so it'll be baggy for a night shirt. However, my brother tried this on as an XXL wearer, and the shirt fits quite well. It's a SLIM fit shirt, HOWEVER, only in the arms from what we've gathered. There's no extra baggage underneath the armpits, and the sleeves fit relatively close to the arms, but very comfortably. The material on this shirt is decently thin and very lightweight. It's quite forgiving with movement and doesn't smother you, or make you feel stiff.

All in all, it breathes very well, has a comfortable worn look & feel, and doesn't make me feel uncomfortable if I wear it to bed, or to the store.
summary: "Blue": worn appearance & feel, well worth it!

reviewText:
I'll start off with my sizing: I'm 5'4" (34B in U.S sizing) and ordered an XL. The fit works pretty well. However, the swimsuit isn't particularly flattering on pear shaped bodies. I see no "slim tummy control" to be honest. If anything, it made me look a little chubbier in the midsection. I have other much more flattering swimsuits that I'll probably stick with until I lose a few tummy pounds (waist ~28/29). This is definitely a push up though; there was a thick underwire in there as well as removable padding. This doesn't pack well because of the underwire and padding. It's actually quite bulky, not ideal at all for light packers traveling on a plane. Takes up about as much room as a pair of jeans. This won't be going with me to Australia, unfortunately for these reasons.
Important point: the skirt isn't really a V shape like in the picture, it's more of a straight across which is fine but also makes it a little less flattering. The undershorts are great, not too tight and not super loose. The back looks pretty, but I'm a bit unsure if the clasp will hold up since I haven't swam in this yet.
I can upload a picture of myself in it later if anyone wants to see it, just leave a comment. The color is a pretty bright red. The swimsuit itself came in a super handy thick reusable plastic zip pouch and also came with a nice random hair tie. I would definitely buy again from this seller but would not recommend this swimsuit itself if you're a little chunky in the midsection. If you're slimmer in that area, I would definitely say go for it if it's still about $18.
very pretty

I love this suit. I've not ever ordered something online that fit so well before. Its both flattering and feminine without being completely immodest, which makes me very happy. The only reason that I'm rating this as four stars instead of five is that it came in the wrong color. Instead of the beautiful deep, rose color depicted, and that I had ordered, I received it in pink. It's still very pretty, but not quite what I normally wear for colors. Although, despite that I am disappointed in the pink color, I kept the suit and it is still the best and most comfortable swim suit I've ever owned.

reviewText: The dress is beautiful, gorgeous.  Some nip & tuck and it looks like it was made for my body.  I'm very pleased.  I will  wear my dress all night.

I was also apprehensive ordering online, and other international sites had bad reviews. I emailed them my measurements and the dress arrived 2 weeks earlier than the early shipment date (Est arrival 4/13-5/4, and it arrived 3/30!) The dress is even more beautiful than in the picture. Lots of sequins, and the silver around the bust and back really sets it off. There is a second layer underneath the skirt area that has a very subtle sparkle in it. I think that there is no bustle in the back, so, that may need to be added. And the bag that it shipped in looked like it would never fit the dress,, but, when i opened it, the dress was folded perfectly with tissue paper protecting it and it wasn't wrinkled at all. I saved 12 weeks and 1000 by not buying something sub-par from the local bridal shop. GREAT PURCHASE!!! Cant wait to wear it!

reviewText:
I was excited by all of the positive reviews on this dress.  It did arrive way ahead of schedule which i was excited about, until i opened it that is. I ordered it strapless and corset back. They did the corset back fine however to my surprise, it still had straps. However after putting it on, I rather like the straps. The biggest issue i have with this dress is that it shows it as well as describes it as a sweetheart neckline but i received a straight neckline which changes the whole look of the dress and definitely not what i wanted. The bust is a lil big also but i was expecting something to that effect and to just fix that in alterations.  I have contacted the seller and hopefully they can correct all these errors and i will update this review.
UPDATE:
The seller was amazing at making this right. They offered to pay for the entire alteration to do the neckline.  I am extremely happy with their handling of the situation.  Also, i must say, every alterations shop I took it to said it was extremely well made. Be cautioned however, they did such a good job at with the details that it will cost top dollar for anyone to take it in or let it out due to them having to remove the beautiful beading and lace, make the cuts along the seam, then put the beading back on it.  I think it will turn out wonderful and i can't wait until it's done.

Final update:
This turned out so beautiful. I've added pics.
summary: Mistakes were corrected to my liking.

reviewText:
I was reluctant to order a wedding dress off of amazon and decided to go ahead and try it. The dress came very quickly and was a very nice quality, but did not fit me right. The top looked blocky as if it should fit someone whose chest had corners instead of being round. I was very disheartened about it and told the seller about my displeasure. They offered to help pay for alterations by crediting me back a discussed amount, which was great but I had hoped by the custom fitting the seller provided I could forgo the pricey alterations. After everything I spent about 400 for the dress, but everyone loved it and couldn't believe how little it cost even with the alterations.  The quality of the dress is great, the back looked beautiful, the customer service was good, and with alterations it came out very well so I am fairly happy with the dress.

Added note, yes it comes with a "veil" but it's not really a veil. It's just the material, you could make the material into a veil of you wanted but it was not a usable entity by itself.

reviewText:
I ordered this dress on April 17th and it arrived April 27th...  I had them customize my dress to have a corset back instead of a zipper closure.  I sent in my measurements then worried about what I would receive and when...  I shouldn't have worried...  This dress is beautiful!  I'm still shocked that I paid less than $200 for it...  I almost feel guilty, like I should send more money.. Lol  I have no idea how they make such a detailed dress for this amount of money!
Emails back and forth were very prompt and pleasant.
I asked for a corset back instead of a zipper and that is exactly what I got for no extra charge.
The dress came in a throw pillow sized envelope which freaked me out!  How this they fit it in there?  The dress is slightly wrinkled but I'd have it steamed anyhow...
The dress had no unusual smells.
Another person said the straps were not attached.  Of course they aren't!  The straps Chris-cross in the back.  If they were sewn in, you'd never be able to put the dress on.  The are small hooks on the straps and looks to hook them on on the back of the dress to hook them on.
Now,  I am a 34 DD..  I was worried that the dress would be too small in that area so when giving my measurements I made a point of telling them my cup size and it turned out to be perfect!  I'd advise women to do this..  Just to make sure it fits correctly.
The length is also perfect with my shoes.
Don't pass this dress up....  It exceeds my expectations!

I have pretty small arms and after a minute of trying it on, my arms were raw at the holes and it left marks on my skin. I was able to fit in the dress but it was tight. I don't know if a larger size would fix the arm hole issue, it might. My second complaint is that the chest area is very hard. It is a sculptured top. Anyone pressing against you is going to feel very hard cups. I bought this dress because I wanted it for my bridesmaids in my wedding and wanted to try it out before others ordered it ... And it gave me an excuse to buy a going out dress. I will say this, the dress is pretty so your bridesmaids can wear it for the wedding but can also use it again to go out and no one would say, that's a bridesmaid dress. My maid of honor touched the chest area and immediately said no to the dress, she didn't like the hard top either. I gave it three stars because while it is a cute dress, there are some things about the design of the dress that I think need to be fixed.

It is a nice bikini. The stock photos are identical to what I got (besides the body ha). I am a 32A bust, hips are 38in and weigh 133ish lbs, so small top and medium bottom usually. I normally wear medium tops, so I chose to get medium. If I ordered the small, they bottoms would have been too tight I think. The top fit me...just slightly a little loose, but I was able to tighten the straps around my back and neck. The top covers a lot of my chest due to me being small chested. I like the bottoms! The back of the bottoms are cheeky, but I love it! They have a scrunched look in the middle and it is cute. The strings on the top and bottom are long and if they are too long for your liking you could cut them and leave them how you want. The top is padded, but if you want them out you certainly can take them out (they are removable). The material is 86% nylon and 14% elastane, so there is stretch to them. The stitching is very nice and was made well. The insides of the top and bottom are line with a soft material!

Overall, it is a nice bathing suit and I will wear it. I also believe the sizing photo was accurate to the size I got. It is definitely not a one size fits all just depends on your measurements.

reviewText: Excellent quality and workmanship. Great fit
Quality was disappointing  . material was very thin , will not purchase again .

I once had a conversation with the CEO of Jockey International and, after a weak response to a question about "today's students" (a frequent, though usually dead-end, subject: you are learner or you're not), I sensed enough of an opening for a question that had long been on my mind--viz. why do Jockey's white men's underpants soon become loose and baggy whereas their black and blue entries always seem to hold their shape? When put to a woman CEO of irreproachable integrity during what was a semi-formal, public event, my internal monitor ruled in favor of the mute button over a query that might be judged in bad taste or, worse, unacademic and impertinent.  The more I thought about it, the more I (like Hamlet) refrained from taking action.

Nevertheless, the question continues to nag--in direct proportion to white briefs that continue to sag.  It was Fats Waller who wrote the provocative, even profound, popular song most often associated with Louis Armstrong, "What Did I Do to Be so Black and Blue?"  The song is saying, "Like it or not, my color is nothing of my own doing--I can't accommodate it to your personal preferences."  But is Jockey equally powerless to make full-rise white shorts that ascend to their wearer's expectations?

Being a student is, by definition, a continual lesson in humility, so I won't pretend to have an answer. I've tried enough brands to learn that the white shorts made by Fruit of the Loom and Hanes fare no better--if anything, both are worse for wear than the Jockey brand.  There's nothing like Jockey black and blues to give a man the welcome feeling of starting the day off with a lift--that sense of having your act together even before taking it on the road and hitting life's always-challenging next stage.  But I refuse not to purchase white shorts along with the colored ones (we all could use a little more humility every 3rd or 4th day).
summary: "I'm white inside, but that don't help my case...": Pops was right, but Jockey's got your back with offerings in blue and black

There are no buttons or zippers to help you with the shoulder width and the fabric has zero stretch. After several yoga moves, I managed to get the blasted thing off, but now I'm scared to wear it. However, if I went up another size, I'm certain the billowy look would have been that much more pronounced. So now I'm stuck, figuratively, with what to do with this blouse. This clutch is gorgeous. I purchased it for my daughter to use for prom. The crystals catch the light And it just  glistens with color. We plan to share it for other special occasions. The clutch  has plenty of room for your phone and a few other essentials for the evening. It also has a chain so you can either carry it or put it on your shoulder if you need to have your hands free. It came in a nice box and it was  in bubble wrap  to protect the crystals. My daughter loves it. It isn't just a one time carry it will accent many outfits and dresses. I highly recommend it. It is worth the price.

I Love everything about this beautiful clutch bag. I love that my phone lipgloss ID fit perfect inside. I love that I can wear it as a cross over or use it as a clutch for dressier evenings. I also love that it has discrete feet to sit upright. This bag is beautiful!

Very pretty.  I purchased several of these sparkly purses from Amazon to find the right one to go with my blue sequin dress for my daughters' wedding.  This is the one I kept.  All of them were lovely in different ways.  But this is the one that was most functional for my needs and a very nice accent to the dress.  I was looking for a functional purse, not just for show.  This purse held my Iphone 6s, plus had room for a couple credit cards (in an inside pocket), a comb, lipstick and Kleenex.  It has a strap which I detached and did not use.  I choose to use this only as a clutch because the rhinestones would catch on the sequins if used it as a shoulder bag.  I would think this purse would go with all different styles of evening dresses. It is truly lovely, and functional.  A little on the heavy side because of all the rhinestones.  I received a lot of compliments.

I received it last night and when I tell you that this purse is gorgeous and the pictures do not do justice!  it is a beautiful, perfect piece of jewelry, well made, blingy, delicate, sophisticated etc..  and I am extremely picky with my accessories. its worth every penny.
I read some reviews saying it's heavy, not at all! The weight of it it's expected for the amount of stone it has.
when it comes to the size, its also expected to be small, no party clutch/purse is ever big, they are usually very small. I have a Samsung 7 edge and it fit perfectly with extra room for some cash, credit cards an ID and 1 lipstick, 1 tampon, 1 lip liner and maybe a small little mirror. Technically all you need if you have a purse like this. I don't write reviews like this but when I was trying to buy one for myself I wish someone had written something like this for me to see! Innovate (the company from whom I purchased the sneakers) have been great to work with, but these sneakers were substandard in terms of build quality/design.  The fit was great -- plenty of width -- but when I swapped out the elastic laces that came in the sneakers with "regular" laces (included in the box with the sneakers), and I gently pulled on them to snug up the fit, the laces tore through one of the red "tabs."  As soon as I took them out of the box, I saw these rather flimsy tabs, and thought to myself "Those don't seem very sturdy!"  Sure enough, they weren't.  Again, Innovate Comfort Shoes was tremendous -- sent out a different brand/style almost immediately in exchange -- but this particular sneaker was pretty abysmal.

I purchased this bag in tan at TJ Maxx. I'm not really a tan/brown person but I got it to go with a new pair of tan shoes. I liked the bag so much that I hunted it down in black. I like nice things but generally don't spend so much money on accessories. This bag, however, is worth it.

The leather is butter-soft, which makes it wonderful to touch and allows the bag to easily shape to the body as it hangs from the shoulder. The bag is really quite large, but doesn't feel or look enormous. I can put a file folder and/or my small laptop in it with no problem, yet I don't feel like I am carting a shopping tote around with me.

There are several pockets on the inside, which is the key to a good bag IMO. The pocket on the front goes all the way across and the magnetic snap on the front flap keeps it from feeling like anything in that pocket will fall out.

**Update, January 2015** I have used this bag almost exclusively since I got it. It's a great shape and size for me, BUT the silver finish is wearing off of the buckle on the front pocket flap. I am very disappointed - I paid way too much to expect  this kind of wear after just a few months.

The Good:  The seller shipped very quickly.  I was amazed at how fast I got the package (it seemed like only a week).  The Bad:  I bought XL for the extra length because I am 5'7", 145 lbs (36B) but when I put it on, the front of the top did not even reach the bottom of my crotch!  I bought this to cover the upper thigh area (that many of us women have trouble with) while wearing leggings and although the back of it is plenty long, the front was a total disaster for that purpose.  The Ugly: To get the shipping wrinkles out, I moistened the fabric with water and put it in the dryer to get the steam to remove some of the folds.  Lo and behold, when I took it out after about 10 minutes, the seams at both armpits were coming apart (about 1" of the way down) and the fabric had shrunk so that now the top only hit my belly button in the front!  Now, if you ironed it I am sure the "shrinkage" would disappear but I'm not an ironer and don't want that hassle.  ACKKKKKKKKKKKKKKKKK.  I am sending it back.  2 stars just because I think the seller is good, but the product is a 1 IMHO.  P.S. It is NOT cotton as the description states.  It is some type of synthetic material.

UPDATE 8/24/14:  After several e-mails back and forth, I was not able to get a full refund from the Seller (Jetest-US).  They are very friendly and respond quickly but will only give you a 50% refund but don't need you to send the item back (so you can keep it and give it to someone very short LOL).
summary: If you are over 5 feet tall and want it for length in the front, RECONSIDER!!!

The red lace that trails down is not actually attached it's dangling and flimsy.  This lace detailing also starts much lower then in picture shows at the mid thigh... Reality is much lower, so it doesn't poof out  like in the photo. I ordered my size based measurements in description. My actual measurements were slightly less. The dress fits!!! however there is so MUCH biege showing in the back! It looks silly!! Perhaps another size up would have looked better.
The good stuff about dress!! It was made well. It has proper bones and structure to keep the dress up and not curling. Overall dress does not meet my satisfaction.

Bathing suit is beautiful but way too small.

At 5' 7" 114lbs, the large fits great. The measurements on the sizing chart were dead on. Love the boy shorts style under the skirt, and the material feels thicker (higher quality) than I expected.

As a few of other reviews mentioned, I did make a couple modifications to make it a perfect fit. First I removed the underwire, which was rather uncomfortable. Removing it was super easy. I just stretched the material tight over the end of the wire on the inside of the swimsuit, and using a sharp razor blade, made a very small slit and pulled the wire right out. There is enough padding in the bra part of the suit to make it look good without the underwire.

The second modification I made was the straps. They fit just a little too tight since I'm somewhat taller and they are crossed straps. I removed the straps and reattached them uncrossed and now it's completely comfortable. That modification did take 20-30 minutes, but I'm not very skilled at sewing.

All-in-all, if I swam more often I would definitely buy a couple more of these swimsuits in different colors, even knowing that I would need to make the above mentioned adjustments.

reviewText:
I have bought this tankini because my friend recommended and linked me to it. I actually today bought another one for my younger sister, in the watermelon red color, because I think that it was modest enough for my standards. I have personally tested it over a sink and in a pool, and the material is good and absorbs the water.

When the package came, I opened it up and found the color to be almost identical to the color in the computer screen picture. I was actually pleasantly shocked, because I hear lots of stories and reviewers say that the color was a little bit off from what they have been aiming to buy. The only thing that didn't work for me was that the place for the bra, or the widening on the top was a little bit too big for me. But that varies with every woman's body figure, so I would recommend actually measuring yourself carefully before you buy, so that you don't miscalculate it(I believe that the measurements are in the information box above). The material feels very bathing-suitish and so that it typical.

I would just like to comment on the shipping, it took the suit more than one month(a tad over that) to get here, because this is manufactured in China. This depends on where you live, but I live in America so I would recommend that you order this is May, or before the summer months even start, so that you have the suit the first time that you ever enter a pool. This shipping time frame was actually a big thing for me, and might be a big thing for you too, because I had to have this bathing suit by a certain date, so that I could pack and so to my camp with it.

This is very modest, and covers your whole body, so if you have certain standards or guidelines(like I do for my camp) this should fit the bill, because it isn't revealing at all. Also, under the skirt there are normal pants, but the skirt just covers over that.

I would recommend buying this, if you are interested in keeping a more modest approach to your swimwear.
summary: I have bought this tankini because my friend recommended and linked me to it

reviewText: I found this dress on anther site for over $450.  Of course paying only $44 from this seller seemed like a way better deal.  I wanted the dress for my wedding that is nearly a year away, so I thought that even if it doesn't work out, I'd have time to find another.  Thank god I still have eight months to find another one, because there is no way I am wearing this, even to dinner. The lace on this dress is not like the picture.  In the picture, the lace is delicate and there is a blue hint to the beading.  On arrival, the dress has a heavy, cheap looking lace and clear shiny appliques.  In the photo, the bottom appears to be full.  In person, the bottom of the skirt is shear and you can clearly see your legs through it lies flat.  Also, the lace on the lower part of the dress is not secured to the sheer tule, so it looks like the dress is not finished.  Unless you're over six feet tall... be ready to hem this dress if you still choose to "roll the dice".

So its not what is advertised.  Now I have to figure out if I want to spend the extra in shipping to return it.  Otherwise for a cheap watch its adequate just not what I wanted.  I wanted an old school wind up because im sick of watch batteries dying then your stuck till you get a new one.

Have decided to go through the hassle of returning the watch.  The seller was insinuating I misread the descriptions when it clearly stated to "wind before each use".  Im now going with a jaragar watch and highly recommend looking into them.  They have great reviews and are old school wind up watches.  They even make abpoint to say their watched DO NOT run on batteries. There arw even fideos backing up that these are quality old school wind up watches.  Now if my watch stops all I have to do is wind it up and reset the time.  No more making an extra trip to get a watch battery and fighting to get it installed.

YES, THEY WERE SUCH A HIT THAT WE USED THEM IN OUR MARRIAGE VOWS N THEY ARE NOW OUR WEDDING BANDS! SO HE WOULD SAY A RATING OF 5 STARS, BUT I SAY ONLY 4-4 1/2, Simply because, the 1st initial ring that I had bought, THE ONE THAT WAS TOO BIG & FROM A DIFF SELLER I BELIEVE, Had plastic and tags, size tags, showing that it was NEW & a booklet of ALL their other merchandise was included in the package, as well as the FREE COMPLIMENTARY GIFT OF THE CHAIN WAS PACKAGED ALSO. And in THIS package literally All it had in it was the little velvet sack with the ring inside of it. Not in Plastic showing it was new, No tags, Bo booklet, AND No receipt or transaction paper, it just seemed very rushed during the packaging process, and it was a seemingly USED product for all I know, if it was NEW I'd expect to see some sort of tag, plastic...something. Also A NOTE TO THE SELLER:::-->Although My Husband Loved your Product, & it was exactly what I had ordered, & very clean/shiny when taken out of the Nice Velvet Pouch You Included, A customer values time and effort put in their shipped product. Please take the time in Future sells to put in a booklet showing some of your other products, or throw in a little something extra for the buyer, like the FREE COMPLIMENTARY GIFT OF THE CHAIN THAT CAME WITH MY FIRST RING I HAD ORDERED, BECAUSE AS A VALUED CUSTOMER, THOSE ARE THE THINGS THAT MAKE ME A QUOTE VALUED CUSTOMER. THANK U & IT IS REALLY A BEAUTIFUL, & SWEET MOMENTUM FOR SOMEONE TO BUY THEIR LOVED ONE! 4 1/2 STARS GOOD JOB OVERALL!!

This is an okay handbag. Don't really love it nor do I hate it.

I wouldn't put much in it that would add a lot of weight since I don't think the strap would hold up for long.

It is perfect for going to meetings or appointments when you need to carry paperwork or documents with you. Or if you're taking a small book, sketch pad, or notebook along with you to relax at the local coffee shop or to use during throughout day.

There is too much lining material inside this handbag. That means I have to be careful when zipping up my handbag so that any fabric bunched up close to the zipper doesn't catch and cause the zipper to get stuck. Which can be a pain.

The coin purse is attached to a tether which is sewn in above the zipper. Not such a great location unless I want the coin purse hanging outside the bag. Which I don't. When the coin purse is hanging so that it's inside the bag, the zipper doesn't close completely.

I don't foresee using this as my main handbag but, for certain purposes and functions it will do nicely.

HDE Women's Classic Faux Leather Medium Tote Shoulder Bag Fashion Handbag

I love my handbag and the color, looks pretty. This tote bag is great for the beach, pool or a casual look.  The material is faux leather.  Is big but lightweight. Has room enough for a wallet, cosmetic bag, brush, cell phone, keys and more.  For the beach or pool can fit a medium towel, sunblock, sunglasses, and more.  I think for the price is a nice tote bag.

Hangle broke off, bag went into the trash.  I got about a month's worth of use out of it.  I loved it while it wasn't broken so I was pretty sad when I noticed it was torn.

Original Review:

I received the hot pink tote and I really like that it's not gigantic, nor is it too small.

Unboxing:
The bag was in a soft white disposable bag and there was plastic wrapped around the handles.  However, this plastic was STITCHED into the top of the bag.  I had to use tiny scissors to free the plastic from all four points where the straps meet the bag.  You can still see little bits of plastic from where I couldn't cut it close enough.

First impressions:
LOVE the color, it's bright and vivid.  I like the tan contrast with the hot pink.  The little wallet is a cute touch.  It has a zipper closure on both the tote and the wallet.  There is one zippered pocket on the inside of the tote and 2 non-zippered pockets on the opposite side.  The lining is a thin black material.

Pros:
Great size to use as a purse without looking like a crazy lady carrying something the size of a suitcase to the grocery store.
The bag has a zipper closure keeping your belongings safe.
The wallet is attached to the tote so that meas it will never be left behind somewhere.

Cons:
Having to cut away the plastic that was protecting the straps during shipment.  Usually this plastic is just wrapped around the handles and is easy to remove but this was actually sewn into the purse.

Overall impression:
Since this won't be my main purse (I'll only use it when I'm wearing something that matches) I'm thinking it will last me quite sometime.  However, I would heed caution if you are planning on using this everyday.

*I received a sample of the Faux Leather Medium Tote from HDE at a discounted price in exchange for my honest review. I was neither paid nor sponsored for my opinions and all thoughts reflected in this review are solely my own. I am disclosing this in accordance with the Federal Trade Commissions 16 CFR, Part 255: Guides Concerning the Use of Endorsements and Testimonials in Advertising.

This is a very basic bag, very lightweight, absolutely will not pass for leather.  I wouldnt use this as my daily purse.

The design is nice- and it'll work for me as a beach bag.  Something I won't be bummed if its stolen, something I won't be bummed out about if my sunblock explodes-and will fit a thin beach towel or a few pieces of clothing.  Stitching could be better, as you can see in one of my pictures, if you pull gently, as a too full bag might, you can see the stitching isn't reinforced and would likely rip if packed heavy or tight.

Looks cheap, feels cheap, but smart structure with the pockets to keep key items easily accessible and I like the top zip, often missing on similar shape\quality bags.

Would be easy to brush off dirt/sand.

reviewText:
I'll start off with the cons.  This organizer fits snugly in my bag.  But due to what I have to carry with me and the shape of the bag, which is somewhat bigger at the bottom, it's hard to distinguish the pockets because it squished in there.  It may not be quite as stiff as it looks in the picture but again that could be because of the shape of my bag.  I may be giving it only 4 stars because it's not exactly what I wanted, but again that may be my handbag.

Now the pros.  It is very close to the purple that shows in the picture if you care that much about the color.  It has the 4 pouches on the outside on both sides.  And another 4 net pockets over those.  The center is plenty wide and there are zippers on the full length of the top on both sides.  So it does have several pockets but they are all fairly large each being half the length of it.  I would prefer some smaller pockets on one side to hold things like pens, etc.

I would recommend  it all things considered.
summary: A good organizer for your handbag.

reviewText: This is exactly what I was looking for! I spent MONTHS looking for a purse organizer for my Longchamp Le Pliage (medium) sized. I don't know why it took me so long, but I read tons of reviews on many purse organizers and compared prices. I mean, these purse organizers aren't even that expensive, they are extremely affordable (don't like using the word cheap). Simply put, it does the job! More than enough pockets and I am crazy about having pockets and organization. If you have a longchamp, you know how crazy it gets inside the purse and how things get lost in translation. I don't know how many times I dig my hand round and round for things just to have it right next to my hand! Lol! Great product. I recommend it!

Arrived on the earliest delivery date. Reviewing straight out of the package:
Brand new and the new bag scent is not noticeable. Just enough arm room to keep slung on shoulder. Relife brand tag is intact on the front side. Made in China but product is from Japan. Just a few stray threads on the sides, can easily snip away with scissors. Inside the bag comes with a thin plastic board to line the bottom to keep the bag's rectangular shape, it can be removed. The bag's bottom have tiny leg stubs on each corner. There are no optional shoulder straps. The image shown here stays true to the product! My only disappointment is that it could've been a bit larger in size and a little longer in length on hand straps... but still a wonderful school bag. If you or a friend loves anime (or modern Japanese fashion) this is a quirky little fashion accessory you'll be able to use everyday! ^^* A little pricey for a student but well worth it.

I will update later on how the bag holds up after a few weeks usage.
summary: Cute and Casual Book Bag! Recommend!

reviewText: It's such a beautiful ring...u can't go wrong

This swimsuit is absolutely precious! It is most definitely made for pear-shaped girls as it fit me really well. The top is a little smaller than I had expected and very thick and stiff--the shape is also not particularly flattering if your breasts don't do the cleavage thing (hard to explain). There is a LOT of removable padding, and when I took it out I was still a little too big even though I'm in between cup sizes 32B/32C. The bottoms fit really well for me! I have a 26 inch waist and 40 inch hips, so there was a little pulling down on the back of the suit but barely any gap! In addition, the bottoms wear snug but do not push up any pudge or create any sort of muffin top! The legs are a bit more snug then I would have liked (23 inch thighs) but it isn't uncomfortable in the least. The construction of the suit is very well done, no loose threads or the like, and the front of the bottoms (though not the back) is lined nicely. Nothing chafes and everything fits quite well! Definitely recommend buying if you're on the fence! I may buy this in the other color!

The bottom are thin, but for the price, it will work for my activities!

The interesting thing is that the top is itsy bitsy, even after removing the padding. You can probably see that in my picture, and I really don't have that considerable of a chest. The bottoms, however, fit me perfectly. So I would probably recommend this most for pear-shaped people, fuller on bottom than top, which I am to some small degree but clearly not enough. That isn't to say that I'm going to return it or anything, I love it, but I will be rocking almost a dangerous amount of cleavage.

No doubt an excellent watch strap. Fine material and craftsmanship. Due to its unique groove design of the lining, it keeps the wrist cool and dry -- at least more so than most other watch straps.

The reason I gave four stars (4.5 at max?) instead of five is the color tone of the leather part. Yes, it's a fine material and finish. But the color tone is not as sophisticated, especially for its price range. I also have a blue with white stitching one, and the same complaint applies to that one also.

Overall this is a very carefully designed and crafted watch strap, and personally the best one I've ever used on my sport watches.

reviewText: Beautiful pattern. I got the Xtra large for safety sake. Glad I did, gave me room to work with. The cups have little more room but again,  I can work it out.

This is the 3rd  corset that I've bought from this manufacturer. The quality is totally fine considering the cost but this is totally sized for tiny Asian women. An American size 10 girl with a 36C bust is a perfect fit in the XXL.

Fit is generally okay, EXCEPT there is NO boning extending into the bust area, and with no straps, and no stiffening of any kind, there is absolutely nothing to hold up the satin area which is supposed to cover the bust. Not even elastic in the top edge, which you might surmise from the photo.  It's just supposed to hang on by luck, I guess. This will never look good.  I plan to return this.  Don't waste your time.

For the price, excellent product. Usually the bust part is wayyyyy too huge on me (I wear an a-cup), but it was surprisingly more snug than I'm used to for cheap plastic boned costume corsets. I'm not a fan of the boning going straight down the sides, it smooshes my hips in too much and makes my waist look thicker because the boning can't curve the way my body does (my hips are a LOT bigger than my waist, curving mostly right at the sides where the boning is). If you're going to buy one, make sure you know how to size it correctly. A lot of people order the wrong size corset and blame it on the product when they size themselves incorrectly. The zipper is VERY visible in the back, right next to the lacing, which I don't find flattering at all. But all in all, for the price I payed this is definitely a solid product.

reviewText:
These are really not as good as they should be. The manufacturer does not understand how to bias the cut of front and back panels to make a wallet capable of holding any quantity of paper money or cards. Since the sailcloth does not stretch at all (as leather does) it is very necessary to pre-form that space with differential cuts. Since they don't do this; it never stretched=s enough to allow you to put bills in, or take them out properly.
When I tried to help them understand this; they were a bit uninterested in the constructive criticism. Next time I will go for a flow fold instead.

reviewText:
I found this wallet because my kids asked what to get me for my birthday and we'd all run out of idea. I had been on the tired, cheap leather wallet train since forever and I thought...what about something made in Virginia, that is durable and distinctive.

I got all that in spades - this wallet is amazing and it looks the exact same as it did when I pulled it out of the giftwrap 6 months ago. (I'll come back in a few years and update). Take a moment to read up on the owners and makers of these products - small-batch built to last and a cool work philosophy. You will not regret the extra dollars you spend on this wallet - i believe mine will last forever or until i lose it.

I've had this wallet since July 2015 (so almost 2 years now) and have used it every day since getting it.  It has held up great over this time period and is still in great shape.  I really love the material, it seems to handle getting wet better than a leather wallet, as it doesn't really soak in the water.

In the id window slot I keep my license and a transit card behind my license (that I just swipe without removing it).  I keep two smaller cards and a big door access card that I don't need to remove in the back pocket.  Then my debit and a back up credit card in the middle pocket, and my main credit card in the front pocket.  So about 8 cards total.

The only real con is that the ID can be a pain to remove if a place requires that you remove it.  It just takes a bit.  I don't need to remove my id often, and I'd get the wallet again, so it isn't a big deal to me.  I'm guessing if I did it more often the id sleeve would get a bit looser, and this would be less annoying over time.

If this one ever gives out, I plan to buy another just like it!

This is the second I have bought. The first lasted me nearly 3 years. The reason i needed to get a second was because the clear plastic was starting to wear out and come apart. I honestly bought it in the first place to prevent myself from hanging on to to many things and it is effective.

Seriously great wallet. Comfortable in any pocket. Lasts as long as any other possibly longer with better care/staging.

reviewText: Oh my goodness!! This purse is adorable! I was skeptical at first about purchasing this bag. But I am so glad I did. Even though its a " mini" it is still big enough for me. It holds my "big fat flap Mundi wallet" and my 6" cell phone with no problem. And I still have room for a note pad and a couple of make-up must haves!! Lol. Its not as small as you may think. I got the blue one and it is a beautiful shade of blue too. And it was packaged perfectly. It came in a material bag to protect it. And bubble packing all around it. And the key fob is a precious addition. Not to mention the lock and key!! I highly recommend this bag. I want one in every color. It looks like the very expensive version. I would like to add something. I was reading the other reviews and one in particular caught my attention. One person was saying that she had to make a hole with a knife in order to attach the straps. NO. NO. NO. Don't do that. The straps attach to the metal on the handles. The other holes that are in the part of the zipper that you pull is for the lock. The lock fits through one piece of rubber and then the other to keep noses out of your business. I hope this helps.

have used this a few times already and its holding up well.  the airlines treat these like garbage, so there are tons of scuffs already on the corners.  got oil on the fabric too.  with all this the unit is holding up as expected.  the wheels are heavy duty compared to other 360 wheels, this was the deciding factor for me as most 360 wheels are think plastic junk.  these are just not thin plastic junk.  i paid ~80 for and for that price this thing is tops.

reviewText: I really liked the fit of the bottom of this suit. It really flattered my tummy area after 2 babies. It was really comfortable and didn't cut into my legs too much at the bottom. I felt the bottom of the suit was true to size according to the size chart. However, the top was too big on me and I didn't feel like it offered a lot of support and shaping that I wanted in a top after nursing 2 kids. I really liked the color of the suit. It was really pretty. This suit was so inexpensive that I was going to keep it anyway so that I could pair the bottoms with a plain navy blue top that offered better fit and support, but my husband didn't like the style. I was kind of on the fence about the style anyway so I ended up returning it. If this is the style of suit you like, I thought this was great for the money. If you have an average or slightly larger than average size chest, this top of this suit might work better for you than it did for me.
summary: Bottom was great, top was too big

reviewText: Based on reviews I ordered a size bigger than my normal size of a small. The medium was too big up top and a little loose around the waist. Ordered a small and fit a lot better. I weigh 128, waist 30 inches, chest 34-35 inches.

The top was busty for me, however, I think that is the point of the style of bathing suit it is. I have a curvy figure and normally get a size medium in swimsuit bottoms because of my booty, however, I felt like the bottoms could have been a little tighter...like I needed a size small in the bottoms. Overall it fit fine and doesn't look loose. I also have had 2 babies, so I like how it comes up and hides my baby pooch, however, still looks and feels attractive without being overly reveling.

reviewText: I ordered one size up because of the reviews but I should've ordered my size

First and foremost, I listen to other reviewers and bought a size up. Second having a mom body, that doesn't work out like crazy and occasionally grabs fast food after practice I never thought I'd have a suit that I felt like I didn't need to hide. I love this suit, its fun to be in a two piece again and feel like I don't have to be in a solid black one piece in order to not feel like a whale. It's flattering to all body types, as a very dear friend ordered one as well and she is smaller than I. I will be ordering more for this summer, as I had a bit of a run in over the 4th of July weekend last year with several water slides, that would be the one down size but I suspect, its more the material of the slide and less the material of the suit, as multiple women has their suit messed up.
summary: Feel like a hot mom, or at the very least like a woman and not a mom!

reviewText:
Frye know's leather. do I need to say more?
i'm so darn picky about fit and finish... yes I know Frye makes their things in China for the most part. also Mexico.
Either way, the leather is top notch and the craftsmanship is as well. I'm not going to knock stars off for that. The end product is excellent and I own many many many frye products... I thought I was bad, I purchased my fiance a pair of her first Frye boots about 2 months ago. Since then, she has purchased 4 Frye bags, yes 4! also 3 pairs of frye dress shoes, and 1 pair of frye sneakers. She's even more of an OCD fit and finish freak. She loves the quality of these products. It won't disappoint. This could be the most expensive DOPP ever? oh well, it's also the nicest one ever. There are many cheaper alternatives. if you must buy something that is made in the USA<  go here http://www.jwhulmeco.com/Travel-Kit-p/89014.htm - it's more expensive and excellent leather and quality. J.W.hulme co is the best. I still love frye's as they are priced well for the quality. They outsource labor to keep the prices lower... yes lower.

cheap price? likely cheap leather, cheap fit and finish. You get what you pay for. most of the time anyhow ;)
summary: Frye's is a house favorite! quality product - bang for your buck!

Style, quality of materials, and unexpected details captured my attention.  Seams are perfectly straight, sewing/stitching is perfectly even and glued seams are tight, even and gap free, without the excessive glue sometimes seen on shoes of this type.;  The sole is firm,, but seems to be quite comfortable for extended periods of wear.  The only complaint I have so far is some slight rubbing from the top of the shoe at the back of each leg (but, some more appropriate socks should resolve that issue), and my feet seem remain quite warm (although oddly dry, so I don't know if it's truly due to a lack of ventilation)  The 10D fit true to size in length, but were slightly wider than average, making the shoe feel roomy, comfortable and light.  The metal CR8REC logo attached via small chain to the right side is an unexpected surprise, as is the herringbone fabric construction.  I've already received numerous compliments when wearing the shoes.

I can't be happier with this purchase. I really got 12 pendants for the price of 1.
The pendant is classic and unique at the same time. Fun, very practical and very, very memorable.
I got 3 different sets as holiday gifts: Blue Topaz, Sapphire and Emerald, but the 3 sets are basically the same one, as each pendant can have any of the 12 stones in it.
They arrived very fast and they look great and I am sure they will be a big hit!
You get inside a nice box one pendant on a chain, and 12 different stones that can go in it.
The whole presentation if fun, impressive and looks very high end.
You notice right away that this pendant is very well made, classic, clean design, and it feels substantial. The 12 round stones are larger than I expected, and the changing mechanism looks very secure and it's easy to work.
I have to admit that I spent probably 20 minutes playing with the different stones, putting them in and out of the pendant. It's amazing how the same pendant can look so different with a different color stone in it, and it's amazing how fast and easy you can go from having a ruby pendant to a sapphire pendant.
Inside the box a small key was included if you don't want to use your nail to open the back to switch the stone.  A Lifetime warranty also came with the pendant, along with an instruction page.
This is probably the perfect gift as you can stop guessing as what color stone you should get. You get them all so you can't really  go wrong.
summary: You really get 12 pendants at the price of one!

reviewText: We actually bought this dress for a slightly different purpose than it is meant for, but it worked perfectly for what we wanted.  Our daughter was having an animal birthday party and wanted to be a snow leopard.  All of the dresses we could find in her size were well out of our price range.  We found this for an amazing price and decided to give it a try.  I was able to alter it so that it fit our seven-year-old and looked much more age appropriate with sleeves and with it reaching past her knees. I also removed the plastic boning and the lace up part of the corset.  I was really impressed with how well it was put together for the price.  We were very excited to make her an affordable snow leopard dress for her party and no one even knew that it was originally a sexy, adult costume.  We were very happy with this product even if we did use it differently.  If I had a different body type I'd consider the original version for myself! :)

reviewText: The only thing I like about this dress is how it looks in the picture. It looks adorable! In person, not so much. The material is not as expected for being "one size" S/M. It's not stretchy at all and there is a zipper in the back, so it is a very specific fit. I normally wear a 2/4 and sometimes 6, depending on brand. This was too large for me. For this style of dress, it won't look good if it's too small or too big, so I really think they need to market it to a specific size instead of making it seem like it fits a variety of sizes. The material also just feels cheap. The straps also fit oddly. There is no stretch in those either, so they won't move with you. They are adjustable, but it's not practical to adjust them every time you want to move a certain way. Very unhappy with the product. I was so excited about it, too. Obviously I returned it and will seek a stretchy fabric version that is more appropriate.

reviewText: So, gonna try to to answer all the questions I had before I purchased these boots.. Whatever size shoe or boot you normally wear, buy that size in this boot, they will fit perfectly. Its a pain trying to guess if somethings gonna fit or not. I wear a size 12 regular and they fit perfectly, they do rub on the heel and around the ankle slightly so break these things in before hitting the field or make sure you have some mole skin in your IFAK. They are 1000 Cordura Nylon, nothing said anywhere about being waterproof. So im going to scotch gaurd these things to make sure i don't get wet.. They are a HOT WEATHER BOOT but you can also purchase the cold weather inserts seperately. The tongue as you can see in the pics is about 1.5 inches from the top of the boot so no water intrusion. Overall very comfortable and very light, time will tell.

This is my second pair of these.  I had the original pair, and they took some getting used to.  (I have some fibram 5 fingers, which helped get me back into the barefootedness of a kid).  The original pair was black, and had more finished (less pliable) material.  They were OK.  Those were the first year they came out.

I saw these on sale for $45.  I can always use some spares, so I purchased them.  Many of the problems I experienced with the original pair seem to have been remedied.  I do not know if they changed construction, but they appear to be night and day from each other.

My only gripe, is more with the seller-- they were advertised as the Coyote & Olive pair (Model TR 115).  I received the pure Coyote pair (Model TR115). reviewText: These are weirdly comfortable. They're boots that you can wear like slippers. I don't own a pair of shoes that I consider more comfortable. Like all the Mini-Mils, they run one size large and have an oversized toe-box, so I'm an 11W, so I ordered 12R, and they're prefect. This is my third pair of Mini-Mils, the other two pair being the 102's in Black, and these 115's are an improved design which is perhaps thicker in the soles, but more padded all around. Somewhat hard to over tighten the laces, but that's a bad habit anyways. I use a Bar-Lace pattern on the over-arch area which makes them even more comfortable, and they look good.
summary: Possibly the most comfortable footwear I've ever owned.

I've purchased many genie bras from Target. This is the first time I bought a set from Amazon. These bras are NOT genuine genie bras. They don't come in genie bra packaging, just a thin plastic wrap.  The "genie bra" stamp on the actual bra isn't the same. The material is thinner and it fits looser. The real genie bra is made of tough material that holds you in place and the same size in this one does not do that. The straps are wider. The removable pads are cheap and not original either. Good for sleep or nursing bra, but If you've ever owned a real one, you'll feel the difference. I think if I never tried the real one, I would really like this, but I hate being lied to.

summary: Watch is very nice, big bezel

reviewText: Great watch

The Shark Sport Watch Model SH159 arrives in a smart red box, nicely embedded in foam and attached to a beautiful leather strap, in a lovely tobacco shade in my case, as I selected the brown option.  One notices immediately that the face is unusually large, so much so that it might even look too big on a man with slim wrists.  On a muscular arm, it looks impressive and certainly eye-catching.

It has an aura of quality and sturdy reliability.  The buttons are easily accessible and work reliably.  The main reading has an hour hand, minute hand and second hand.  On the right is a date display and on the left is the second time zone reading.  Very handy for people who travel abroad, as it completely eliminates the annoying and sometimes confusing procedure of changing to the local time back and forth.  Given the partial dial, this second time reading is approximate as regards the minutes but, for precision, one can refer to the minutes on the main dial. The booklet of instructions covers nine watch models, but the SH159 is not one of them.  I found that the closest model is the QTM2.  In any case, operation is fairly simple.

To change the date:  Pull out the largest, central crown (on the right hand-side) a very small amount (first position) and turn to set the day's number (14 for the 14th day of the month).  Push back to set.

To adjust the time:  pull the largest, central crown out fully (second position) and turn to set the time.  Press back in when done.

To set the secondary time (for a different time zone): Pull out the left knob and turn to required hour setting.  Push back in to confirm.

Stopwatch operation:  the starting position should be zero.  Push the top knob (A) on the right to both start and pause or stop the count.  Press the bottom knob (B) to reset the chronograph hand to 0.

I like the lightness and comfortable feel of this watch on my wrist.  Despite its imposing size, it does not weigh down my wrist and arm.  It looks edgy and reminds me of a rugged Diesel watch.  The quartz movement is precise and the watch does not require rewinding.  The miniature battery which powers its movement is said to last approximately 2 years, after which it should be replaced by an authorized dealer.  It is rated 3 ATM, which means that it can take splashing and rain, but should not be immersed in water.

I love the leather strap, with its easy adjustment (the holes are straight slits, very easy to engage) and I generally like the look and the feel of this watch.  I was asked by the vendor to evaluate a sample watch for review purposes.  The reason I have withheld the fifth star is that, to my ageing eyes, the readings are very difficult to discern.  The hour and minute hands are grey over a black face and the only stand-out hand is the yellow second hand.  Also the main watch dial only shows numbers for the hours 7, 8, 10 and 11.  The other positions are a matter of guesswork.  It is actually easier to read the secondary time as the digits are printed out, grey again for the main hours and yellow for the half hours.  If this watch had been designed to be easier to read, it would have scored top marks with me.
summary: Cool, attractive, manly watch but a little hard to read

**** Update****
