reviewText: So, I have this friend whom I totally worship, and sometimes she acts like she likes me back, ha. Got her this for Valentine's Day when she was away, and now that she's back in town, she finally put it on for me. I gotta say, it was sexy as hell. Having said that, it was pretty cheaply done too. I mean, there was some major fraying thread hanging from the bow on the chest, and why was the bow on the panties in the front? It's supposed to be in the back on the actual character and in the item pics too! Hmm, maybe she put that part on wrong, I don't know, but she knows the characters well, so I can't imagine why. Well, the bottoms weren't on for long anyway, and it still looked amazing while they were. I suppose the fraying threads are easily clipped. As for size, well, they seemed perfect for her, but she is quite petite. Not exactly short, but a fair amount shorter than me (I'm 5'9), and pretty much physically perfect (small but not too small on top). I have no idea if I'll see her in these again ever, so I don't know how they'll last or even how they do in the wash, but if someone took the time to fix the frayed areas, they are darn sexy, and I'd so love to see her in some of the other Scout outfits, ha. If you're one of those lucky golden boys who is dating a full-on cosplayer, you don't need this, but for the rest of us, this is a sweet item for sure! Make some Disney ones now too! And a few other characters I can think of!

reviewText: so lovely

I bought this simply because I'm a huge Sailor Moon fan. At the time I placed my order they didn't have any Sailor Moon suits in my size, so I went with my 2nd choice; Sailor Mars. I'm 5'2", 110lbs and ordered a small. The bottoms were a little baggie because of my lack of butt, but the top fit perfectly! I'm usually a 34C/32D and it's just like wearing a bra.
However, my only misconception with this product was that I half expected it to be a swimsuit -hence the "bikini set" in the title. This is however NOT the case AT ALL. There's no bathing suit liner or anything like that, it's made of cheap costumey material. I may just hand sew in liner myself.
My only complaint for this product was how poorly it was put together. The bows aren't even sewn on, they're two strips of fabric help with a little elastic on the chest and bum. A good portion of the thread was fraying out, and the stitiching wasn't even even for the white ribbon on the sailor piece. I'm glad I have sewing skills to fix all these little things that add up to A LOT of problems with it. If I didn't have the skill, I would've sent it back.
summary: Cheaply made, but fitted my sailor scout nerd cravings.

Ordered awesome sweatpants from a different retailer a while ago, I loved them. They started getting torn up at the bottom so I tried to reorder them from the same retailer, and they were completely different pants and I hated them. The original pants were branded MOPAS and these were branded Zenana Retailer. I decided to try to see if I could find the actual brand on Amazon, as I bought them from a generic retailer that didn't list brand. So I ordered these specifically because they are branded as Mopas. Lo and behold, they arrive today, and they are the same garbage Zenana Outfitters sweatpants I got last time. So now I have two garbage pairs of sweatpants and one awesome pair that is falling apart after being worn every day for three years and no way to replace them. Great.

Mopas' is my favorite. No matter what size you are, one wash needed to shrink length first. I live in them-literally! Can be used day time, dress up with flare for high heel boots. Tight, nice slimming look. A good elastic waist that doesn't stretch out, or need folding over. I have researched so many, and this is the best to use in place of pants. Not sure if best for yoga, as the length and flare is more dressy. I do wear with flat boots running around doing errands. Careful washing, use stain remover on real stains. Wash on cold, and dry on low heat, except for first wash. First time I bought, I figured no size woukd fit cause of the length. I'm 5'5", and that one wash shrank the length, but not the entire size. And although I have accidentally washed on hot and dried on heavy heat since, they don't keep shrinking or loose the thick quality. But if continue to wash on hot , will loose darkness. Hey, for the price, you can always buy more. I have over 25 pairs, that's living in them. They fit true to size. I'm a Medium, but buy small for a tight sexier look. Basically the perfect black pants in my mind, and so comfy!
summary: More for dress up, daily wear. Follow my tips!

reviewText: Definitely cute! I've worn it once, I love it already

Timezone123 is who I prefer to buy watches from from now on. Usher really made sure I was happy to have this watch in my collection and when I was not satisfied made sure I got a new watch that worked as specified.

Onto the watch - it is big and beautiful. That carbon fiber face is a great detail and couples well with the stainless steel. My only complaint and it is not that big of a deal is that the movement of the chronograph does not line up perfectly with the second markers. It is off by a mm or 2. This is something I tried to get fixed but cannot because it is gear specific. Cannot really notice it but it kills me because of my attention to detail.

Also the watch band is falling apart and doing very poorly with minimal use. I will replace the band and suck up the slightly off movement to wear this watch.

Now where in the world would you ever find a carbon fiber chrono that is 1000 ft. WR for around $100?  I love this watch.  It keeps great time, is very easy to read, and is big, but not ridiculous.  There are only two things I would improve on.  First, for a watch this size it is difficult to read the date.  A 2.5X magnifier would be perfect.  Second, the band is comfortable, but is not holding up well.  The outside material is flaking off and doesn't look good after only a few weeks on the wrist.  Still, a great value and I would highly recommend to anybody looking for a super looking, inexpensive timepiece.
summary: Great looking watch for the dollar

I had to return all of them and and that cost me a pretty penny and way too much time, because it came from China or Japan and I had to complete all of this paperwork at the post office and paid way too much to send them back internationally.  To make matters worse, I had to send them back separately because 2 of the items came with separate UPS codes and the other 2 came with no return mailing paperwork, so I had to pay $21.00 each to the USPS to mail back.  Wasn't worth it and needless to say I'll never make that mistake again.  The Asian clothing just runs way too small and the companies really need to correct this if they want return business.
summary: I had to return all of them and and that cost me a pretty penny and way too much time

reviewText: These fit and feel good.

I'm 5'9" and 149 lbs. I typically wear a size 30 or 31 waist pant. I have larger rear end and thighs thanks to exercise. So I usually opt up from a small to medium. Size M fit well on me. Why I bought this product: I was looking for stay-on mittens and socks for my newborn and these were cute. These were also the only ones that I found with velcro fasteners.

How the product worked: These mittens and booties are a bit pricey but they stay on better than ones without the velcro. The mittens are also reversible so you have some versatility. I used these in the winter and they kept my newborn warm. Note: These are thicker than the thin cotton mittens and socks. I kept these on my newborn inside the house for hours and it was a bad idea. His hands were wrinkly from sweat and his feet smelled from the sweat as well. I used thin cotton mittens at home and saved these for outings. For outings these are great. The velcro stays on and the thicker material keeps the baby warm. For winter, I would suggest socks under the booties when going outside.

Our baby hates hats with a serious passion. She let me put this one on without a protest and fell asleep with it on; I think the super soft organic cotton does the trick. I didn't think I would be so excited about a hat, but I love this one! We have a bunch of little caps from target or carter's that came with outfits people gave her; all of them are way too small by the time she hits the size on the tag. This one has an adjustable brim (seriously, why don't all baby hats have this?) and is stretchy; it fits her perfectly at 3 months and should still fit by the time fall rolls around.
Pros:
- Size- Adjustable brim; hat should actually fit the full age range.
- Fabric- Soft fabric is tolerated by a dedicated hat hater.
- Double layer of lightweight cotton is perfect for cool to warm temperatures. It seemed to keep her plenty warm on some cool Minnesota spring days, but she didn't overheat when I used it to keep the sun off her head on a 75 degree day.
- Cute muted colors are actually gender neutral and pair well with lots of outfits
Cons:
None!

I purchased  the Microfiber Organizer Cover with Study Kit (Size Large Color Burgundy), as well as the Deluxe Organizer Bible Cover with Study Kit (faux leather) (Size Large Color Burgundy) on October 22, 2017, so this review is based on the information given on Amazon's website on that date and based on the covers I received a few days later.  Sometimes Amazon starts selling the same product by a different manufacturer, or the manufacturer makes some changes, but the listing info isn't changed.  For that reason, I clarify that the information here is as it was on October 22, 2017.
NOTE: When I purchased them, the listings said "White Dove" and no mention of "Dickson". But when I clicked on "Buy it Again" from my orders list a week later, the Microfiber one comes up saying Dickson, instead of White Dove.  Same dimensions and info, and the picture looks identical.  The listing was White Dove when I bought it and the card on the cover I received says White Dove.  The faux leather one now says "White Dove by Dickson" on Amazon.  The card attached to the one I received says only White Dove. No mention of Dickson on either Bible cover I received, but that doesn't necessarily mean they aren't the same covers now as the ones I received.

The microfiber case and the faux leather case have almost the same design, so, for comparison, I will review them as one, mentioning differences. The fabric from which they are made is different of course.  The microfiber is a sturdy cloth that has a sheen to it, almost like nylon's sheen, but heavier and nicer.  It has white stitching for detail, while the faux (fake) leather cover has burgundy stitching that is not noticeable.  You can of course tell it is not real leather, but it's nice.  On the faux leather cover, all the zippers and zipper pulls are burgundy to match the cover. On the microfiber cover, all the zippers and pulls are burgundy except the pull on the smallest outside compartment, which is shiny metal with a cross on it. Very attractive.
Color - I ordered both in burgundy.  They are dark burgundy, with the faux leather one being darker, looking almost dark brown.  The colors on my computer screen are very true to life for both covers.  The card attached to each cover states they were made in China.

DO TAKE NOTE, IN CASE YOU'RE BUYING FOR A MALE:  The card attached to the microfiber  one says "LADIES DELUXE ORGANIZER".  Why it specifies for ladies I'm not sure, unless the manufacturer thinks the white stitching looks more for ladies, and perhaps the fabric with a sheen. The faux leather one definitely does look more masculine, but a woman would be comfortable carrying it as well.  If you remove that card, there's no information anywhere.  Each case came in a clear plastic bag only - inside a shipping box of course. I mention this in case you are giving it as a gift.

SIZE - At the time I purchased, the Amazon listing for the microfiber cover said, way down below under Product description:  inner dimensions 9 3/4 x 6 3/4 x 1 3/4.
The faux leather deluxe organizer said, right up in the description near the top, for size Large: Bible cover measures approximately 10.5 x 7.5 x 2.

Based on those measurements, I expected them to both comfortably fit two identical Bibles, measuring 9 5/8 x 6 3/4 x 1 5/8.  When I received the covers, however, the cards attached to them said:  Large fits books up to 9 1/2 x 6 1/2.  No depth was given, but these measurements are definitely smaller than what the Amazon listing told me.

And, unfortunately, both covers were too small and the zipper would have chewed the corners of the Bible cover if we had tried to force it.  If I had to guess, I would say the 9 1/2 x 6 1/2 inches is probably accurately what this size Large covers will accommodate, though I didn't have a Bible that size to try it.  I definitely do not think they would accommodate a Bible 2 inches thick.  If the width of the Bible were less than 6 1/2, then perhaps. 1 3/4 inches thick?  Maybe, but I can't say for sure.  The microfiber cover seems to have a little more "give" than the faux leather one.

On both, when you unzip the Bible compartment, it has the usual panel on each side to slide your Bible cover into.  The microfiber one had a built in ribbon bookmark. The faux leather one did not.  Neither one had a pen holder in the Bible compartment.

When you unzip the notepad compartment, it has a steno notepad (VERY few sheets of paper) on one side that measures 8 1/4" (from the top of the spirals) by 5 1/2". The cards say the steno pads measure 9 x 6.  When it's time to replace the pad, you can use a Jr. Legal Pad if you prefer. There is a slit at either end of the notepad compartment, so you can turn the pad upside down and turn the cover the other way, putting the Bible in the other way, and thereby have the notepad on the left side of the Bible instead of on the right side of the Bible, for left-handed people.  It works fine either way.  BUT: do realize, the notepad is separated from the Bible by a flap, since the Bible and notepad are in totally separate zipper compartments.  So if you leave the Bible inserted in its compartment and the pad inserted in its compartment, you would have to flip back and forth, back and forth to read from the Bible and then write on the pad.  Or, you could remove either the Bible or the pad from the cover while writing.
Amazon sells other covers that are tri-fold (three fold), which means the notepad folds out to be beside the Bible, so you can take notes without having to remove either the pad or the Bible.

There is one elastic pen holder beside the notepad.  On the other flap of the notepad compartment, there are pockets that run across the short direction of the cover, so that they won't be upside down no matter which way you use the cover - left handed or right handed.  They will always go side to side.  These are narrow pockets, some narrower than others.  They can be used to hold pens, markers, highlighters.
Zipper close these two compartments, and we will look at the outside of the organizers.  The back is plain - no pockets.  There is a handle on the spine, made out of the same material as the rest of the cover. There is a zipper pocket on the front, with a smaller zipper pocket on top of the larger one.
The larger pocket measures barely 7" x 5", with rounded corners  It has a double zipper so you can unzip it all the way to the bottom on both sides and completely open the flap, which, if you do, would allow whatever is in it to fall out easily. My Samsung S7, which is in a sleek/low profile case, fits easily. There is room for something else beside my phone, such as a comb and lipstick. A 6 inch ruler would fit nicely in this compartment to use for underlining.

The smaller pocket on top measures about the same size on the outside, but the straight zipper only opens 4 3/4 inches, plus part of the compartment is up above the zipper.  It is smaller on the inside than the other compartment.  I cannot get my phone in the small compartment.  It would be good for keys, credit cards, cash, or other small items. And again, a 6 inch ruler would fit in this compartment - if you angled it in.

Both covers come with 4 highlighters (green, blue, orange and pink) and a ball point pen, sealed in a little cellophane bag. The card says they are twist up dry highlighters, but I didn't open the bag.
summary: Nice Organizer Cover, but read my review about dimensions!!!!!!!

reviewText:
The colors are not varied to the extent as shown in the picture.  The product arrived intact, no missing stones, however the stones are all a bright/royal blue, None of the sky blue.and those 'white' stones are actually inlay rhinestones.  If I hold the necklace up to the light, I can see that different types/paints were used on what was to be the lighter sky-blue intended stones, but in 'normal' light, they're just swirls in the same blue as the rest.  Not a high dollar expense, and my expectations were not high, but I do want what I order to arrive looking like the picture.

If you're looking for a royal blue necklace with a few rhinestone embedded accents, this works.  I'll give it an OK, but what I really wanted was the versatility of different blue colors that unfortunately I didn't get,
summary: but I do want what I order to arrive looking like the picture

I got this in both the blue and purple versions, and I really  like them both. This blue one has lots of green and yellow flashes in the stones. It's a lightweight necklace, even though it's quite large.  It has a lobsterclaw clasp, and the earrings are french wires.  This necklace is fun to wear, looks great with jeans and a sweater, and gets lots of attention.  It's probably a bit much in most workplaces, but if your workplace is a bit funky, it might be acceptable.  The stones have an opalescent quality, and refract and play with light in interesting ways.  This would be a great gift for a teenager who likes jewelry, a girlfriend who likes funky, and the price makes it a great 'just because' gift.  This will get you noticed, but if you like showy jewelry, this is for you.
summary: Lots of fun for a great price

reviewText: The arm openings are a little snug and short, at the wrists(I'll throw on some cuff bracelets), can't roll them up because they are too tight to do so. The bust is a little tight, the hip area is fine and waist is a tad loose. I am 5' 6" 120#'s 36x25x36 and ordered a size "S".  The quality is fairly shoddy, lots of loose strings dangling everywhere, very very thin material, reminds me of knock off "under armor" under garments/sports clothes. I knew it wasn't coming from Nordstrom's, Macy's or even J C Penney's, so, I expected less than perfection. I will have to merchandise it up to cover some of the fit flaws as well as the lack of substance as far as the grade of materials used. For work or Church you will definitely need to wear a slip unless you want everyone to see...,pretty much everything the minute you pass by a light source, even a candle! It's not the best and it's not the worst I have ever seen, order up one size at least if you are concerned more with the arms, than the waist fitting you. The belt I purchased in anticipation of the waist being too large was even too large, so, I will have to pick up something locally and pass the belt on to a friend. Hope this helped in your decision making process, happy bargain hunting!

Lightweight, feels like a feather, but still very solidly constructed. Flexible hinges that allow minimal backward bending without breaking the hinge. Polarization is excellent, blocks out the sharp sun glint that comes off bright chrome on cars or water puddles on a sunny day. Only negative is that it makes phone screens look a little oily due to the way the polarization affects bright light. But that's universal to polarized glasses, really just calling it out for anyone unfamiliar with them. It's not bad once you get used to it, and living in a very sunny climate, it's more than worth the trade to not be blinded every time you're following a car with any chrome.
summary: Solid construction but very lightweight, flexible hinges, good polarization

reviewText:
I'm writing this review a day before I leave to study abroad in Madrid. I first emailed Allegory worried that I might not receive my order in time for my flight but they assured me they could ship it on time.  They kept their word and sure enough it came in the mail last night.

They hand wrote me a kind letter wishing me the best on my trip, as well as a card displaying your name that fits inside the pocket. The quality of leather is genuine with strong stitching to hold cards and American sized bills. The clip on the back holds even bigger forms of international currency. The metal is malleable to hold more bills when folded.  You can even take out the clip if you just want to use that. The pouch (I got the zipper model) is thin but can hold a good amount of change which is perfect for small coin euros.

The customer service of this company is truly kind and genuine, they kept their word and were so cool and polite. For such an expensive wallet, you feel good about using a high quality product backed by a decent company who cares about their customers.

If I had a criticism it would be that I personally wish the wallet would also come with scan protection, but if you are a nut about security than that option is open as well in another model.

If you're looking for a company with style and actual humans to speak with, look no further.
summary: They hand wrote me a letter wishing me the best on my trip and the wallet comes with a ...

reviewText:
Aesthetically, this thing is very slick. The leather on the outside is soft, and the stainless steel mesh has a look all its own. Functionally, it's exactly what you'd expect from a traditional bifold. It's worth noting that because of the mesh on the inside, you can't over stuff the pockets. It doesn't have the stretch that leather or cloth or nylon might. So, if you carry more cards than there are slots, this wallet might not work well for you. My only complaint is that it's expensive. I have no idea what goes into the manufacturing of these wallets, so maybe that cost is justified, but for my purposes, it isn't quite worth the price tag.

If the price doesn't bother you, this is a really attractive wallet that works well.
summary: Slim, attractive, but worth the price?

reviewText: Awesome shorts just ran a little smaller

I got this wallet as a Christmas gift.  I am a big fan of Johnston & Murphy products--I have one of their briefcases that I love.  The wallet hits some marks--good layout, size, organization.  It is slim, but not what I would consider "Super Slim." But the big issue I have with it is that it sticks.  Cards stick in the slots, the license sticks to the plastic window, the wallet sticks together when closed, the pocket on the back sticks closed.  I have no clue why it does this, but it is a pain every time I use it.  My hope is that it subsides with time and use.  But I am skeptical as it seems as if the leather is treated with something and it feels kinda cheap.  I will try and follow up after a few months after it breaks in as it may just be because it is new.

For the price, if it stops sticking, I think this is a good wallet.  However, if you are looking for a nice wallet that holds up and are willing to spend more, I think that Hartman makes the best.  I have owned a lot of wallets over the past few years--J&M, Coach, Tumi, Bellroy and others, and the Hartman was the most durable and best quality IMO.
summary: I am a big fan of Johnston & Murphy products--I have one of their briefcases that I love. The wallet hits some marks--good layou

reviewText: Johnston & Murphy Super Slim Wallet (Dark Brown) Been using this for 2 months now. Wallet feels like genuine leather and is much thinner than my previous wallet. It also has a very useful outside pocket that will comfortably fit 2-3 credit cards/IDs. Definitely worth getting at this price point.

reviewText: After owning this for a few months I find I love it. It is soft & silky, washes great and has vivid colors and an interesting print. It is not as roomy as a L should be around your middle tho. Looks great with black slacks.

The cash section is difficult to use; bills folded in half fit size wise, but the material is a bit 'sticky' making bills not want to go in easily. I have an old Knomo wallet that looks nearly identical to this that is just worn out (and they don't make it anymore). I was trying to get something similar, but will look elsewhere.

reviewText: I read lots of reviews before I purchased this corset. I wear a size 14/16 which is normally about a 1X-2X. Most reviews claim that the item runs small so I bought a 3X just to be safe. I figured I could always tighten the laces as I got more comfortable with it. Was super excited when it arrived and to my disappointment, guess what size came in the mail? A small...  I'm all for reaching goals but this corset is a size that (at 6'1" and even if I could be this size I would look sickly) I would never be. Maybe it was a seller error but I don't know how 3X turned into small, which it is clearly marked on the clear plastic bag the corset came in. Due to the time it took for it to get here, it's not worth retuning so, I will give it to someone who can wear it.  The quality of the corset seems to be very nice except for the fact that the clasps don't stay fastened but maybe they will stay when someone actually wears it...

reviewText: I purchased this watch from another source, but I loved the style so much I'm looking for another of the JBK-inspired line, perhaps in a black band.  So glad amazon.com carries this JBK selection now!  This watch has gotten more compliments than any other watch I've ever worn.  While it does have a few crystals around the gold-tone case, it's definitely a more casual watch.  The white dot-like things you see on the band are actually woven bits of leather, and that's what gets the most compliments.  It looks high end in styling, and it's very comfortable to wear.  I like a looser band, so this suits my purpose nicely.  I imagine it would fit even a nine-inch wrist or larger, but I have it cinched quite a bit smaller.  The band can be trimmed for smaller wrists for those who don't want to wear the watch as loosely as I do.  I wish there were more photos so everyone could see how stunning it is.
summary: Most complimented watch I've ever worn.
